page.title: 11Beauty Spots In Wendover
page.content: Wendover nestles in a valley at the foot of the Chiltern hills of Coombe, Bacombe, Haddington and Boddington, all of which provide spectacular walks amidst magnificent beech woods. To the south-west of the village is Coombe Hill - 852ft - the highest point in the Chiltern range from whose summit on a clear day, one can look over five counties. Below this wooded hill lies Chequers Court, country residence of the Prime Minister, whose park lands extend to the ancient earthwork castle of Cymbelines Mount. Walkers frequently visit the village on their journey along the Ridgeway Path and the nearby Icknield Way. North of Wendover is the village of Halton, where the Rothschild family made their splendid home which later became the offices' Mess. The gardens were later used as Barracks in the First World War.
